availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Native of Kentucky. Worked as a lawyer in Mercer County. Owned ten slaves in 1860. Active in colonization and emancipation movement in Mercer County.

Spouse: Georgiana Taylor
Children: Rebecca Taylor

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, page 19.
U.S. Find a Grave Index, 1600-Present, James Taylor, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=100141379&ref=acom accessed 03/13/2017.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, page 3.
The Louisville Daily Courier, "Public Meeting in Mercer," April 19, 1849, page 2.
